editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic lightâ€”itâ€™s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstarâ€™s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

ios.subtitle: Itâ€™s not a bug, itâ€™s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: Team up with an ancient Mayan warrior and solve perilous puzzles in this twin-stick adventure.

editorialNotes.tagline: Ollie and flip for high scores
editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axisâ€™ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.standard: Youâ€™re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. Weâ€™ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

In this gorgeous twist on the infinite runner, you guide an agile snowboarder down a never-ending mountain, pulling off backflips over icy chasms and grinding along rooftops in sleepy villages. Simple one-finger controls make it instantly accessible, but tackling each levelâ€™s trio of challenges requires deft reflexes. With its exquisitely rendered visuals, soothing music, and finely tuned gameplay, Altoâ€™s Adventure is simultaneously serene and exciting.
editorialNotes.short: We're obsessed with nailing the perfect run while admiring the gorgeous scenery.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Blast demons and upgrade your weapons as you climb a massive staircase to the clouds in this nimble roguelike.
Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, itâ€™s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

Pixel-perfect art brings a lost world to life in the gorgeous Hyper Light Drifter. Explore vivid forests, bright landscapes, and the shell of a high-tech society overgrown by nature as you seek to cure a fatal illness. Packing silky smooth, lightning-fast combat, Hyper Light Drifter is a blastâ€”even when youâ€™re just admiring the scenery.

editorialNotes.tagline: Can you become king of the hill?

editorialNotes.standard: Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversariesâ€”and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: While Hitman GO carved out a bold new direction for Agent 47, his next iOS mission expertly captures the riveting gameplay of the venerable console series. You wonâ€™t be donning disguises to sneak into enemy compounds (the gameâ€™s all about sniping), but you still carefully scout each location, unravel the intricately woven level design, and then strike with impeccable timingâ€”or die and try again. Hitman: Sniper does its legacy proud with 150 missions full of engrossing action and the seriesâ€™ quirky sense of humor.

Set in a snowy Nordic fantasy world, Bad North is about doing the best you can with what youâ€™ve got. Command troops of archers, swordsmen, and more as you protect a chain of islands from marauders, but one wrong move can prove costly. Tense, slick, and stylish, Bad North is a heady blend of tactical combat, strategic planning, and intuitive controls.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, itâ€™s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: GoatZ poses a simple question: How long can you survive the apocalypse â€¦ as a zombie goat? This hilariously absurd follow-up to Goat Simulator takes tons of survival-game conventionsâ€”like crafting, time-based challenges, and a big, open worldâ€”and wraps them together in a package intentionally littered with glitches. As you make your way around town, licking trash cans and head-butting zombies, the ridiculous bugs and hysterical premise will have you laughing out loud. Itâ€™s dumb fun in the best way.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but thereâ€™s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged societyâ€”and unravel supernatural mysteriesâ€”in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Follow the story of the acclaimed animeâ€”or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroesâ€”in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The Dynamic Duo take to the stars in a brick-bashing adventure the whole family will love. As you travel from the Batcave to the Justice League Watchtower to deep space, hilarious banter and breezy puzzles make for classic LEGOÂ®-game shenanigans. And with more than 100 playable charactersâ€”everyone from DC mainstays (The Flash, Wonder Woman, Sinestro) to delightful lesser-knowns (Etrigan, Plastic Man, Stargirl)â€”the fan service is unreal.

editorialNotes.tagline: A classic that never gets old

editorialNotes.standard: Dandara is full of fascinating movement. Everything from weapon effects to subtle background details are beautifully animated. Swipe to launch yourself from platform to platform, and with practice, darting past obstacles while blasting enemies can be achieved with almost poetic precision. Impressive level design offers thrilling, almost puzzle-like combat and hides plenty of secrets for more patient adventurers to pursue. This is not an easy game, but for those willing to learn its intricacies, Dandara is immensely rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Ready for a challenge? Leap into this fascinating, unforgiving adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

editorialNotes.standard: Talk about wild family outings! Help the Bergson bunch battle evil in this gorgeous throwback RPG.

We're positively floored by Block Fortress's masterful mixture of crafting and tower-defense. Whether you're collecting resources, creating an impenetrable fortress out of cubes, or using weapons to fend off invaders, this block-builder is surprisingly complex and engaging thanks to its massive scale and endless building potential.
